Given a vector of integers, sort the integers that are between 1 and 9 inclusive,
reverse the resulting vector, and then replace each digit by its corresponding name from
"One", "Two", "Three", "Four", "Five", "Six", "Seven", "Eight", "Nine".

For example:
  arr = {2, 1, 1, 4, 5, 8, 2, 3}   
        -> sort arr -> {1, 1, 2, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8} 
        -> reverse arr -> {8, 5, 4, 3, 2, 2, 1, 1}
  return {"Eight", "Five", "Four", "Three", "Two", "Two", "One", "One"}

  If the vector is empty, return an empty vector:
  arr = {}
  return {}

  If the vector has any strange number ignore it:
  arr = {1, -1, 55} 
        -> sort arr -> {-1, 1, 55}
        -> reverse arr -> {55, 1, -1}
  return = {"One"}

#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
#include<map>

vector<string> by_length(vector<int> arr){
    vector<string> v;
    map<int,string> m;
    for(int i=0;i<arr.size();i++){
        m[arr[i]]=to_string(i);
    }
    for(auto it=m.begin();it!=m.end();it++){
        v.push_back(it->second);
    }
    sort(v.begin(),v.end());
    for(int i=0;i<v.size();i++){
        v[i]=v[i].substr(0,1)+v[i].substr(1);
    }
    return v;
}
vector<string> reverse(vector<string> v){
    vector<string> r;
    for(int i=0;i<v.size();i++){
        r.push_back(v[v.size()-1-(i+1)]);
    }
    return r;
}

    vector<string> r;

    sort(r.begin(),r.end());
    r=reverse(r);
    return r;
}

Given a non-empty vector of integers, return the sum of all of the odd elements that are in even positions.


Examples
solution({5, 8, 7, 1}) ==> 12
solution({3, 3, 3, 3, 3}) ==> 9
solution({30, 13, 24, 321}) ==>0
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using 
 namespace std;
int solutions(vector<int> lst){
    int sum=0;
    for(int i=0;i<lst.size();i++){
        if(lst[i]%2==0){
            sum+=lst[i];
        }
    }
    return sum;
}
int main(){
    vector<int> lst;
    int t;
    cin>>t;
    while(t--){
        int n;
        cin>>n;
        for(int i=0;i<n;i++){
            cin>>lst[i];
        }
        cout<<solutions(lst)<<endl;
    }
    return 0;
}

solution({3, 3, 3, 3, 3}) ==> {3, 3, 3, 3}
solution({30, 13, 24, 321}) ==> {30, 13, 24, 321}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using 
 namespace std;
vector<int> solutions(vector<int> lst){
    vector<int> res;
    for(int i=0;i<lst.size();i++){
        if(lst[i]%2==0){
            res.push_back(lst[i]);
        }
        else{
            res.push_back(lst[i]+lst[i-1]);
        }
    }
    return res;
}

        cin>>n;

            cin>>lst[i];
        }
        cout<<solutions(lst)<<endl;
    }
    return 0;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Create a function that takes integers, floats, or strings representing
real numbers, and returns the larger variable in its given variable type.
Return "None" if the values are equal.
Note: If a real number is represented as a string, the floating point might be. or,

compare_one(1, 2.5) ➞ 2.5
compare_one(1, "2,3") ➞ "2,3"
compare_one("5,1", "6") ➞ "6"
compare_one("1", 1) ➞ "None"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
#include<algorithm>
#include<boost/any.hpp>
using namespace std;
boost::any compare_one(boost::any a,boost::any b){
    double  numa,numb;
    boost::any out;
   
    if (a.type()==typeid(string))
    {
        string s;
        s=boost::any_cast<string>(a);
        if (find(s.begin(),s.end(),',')!=s.end())
            for (int i=0;i<s.length();i++)
                if 
 (s[i]==',') s=s.substr(0,i)+'.'+s.substr(i+1);
        numa=atof(s.c_str());
        
    }
    else 
    {
        numa=boost::any_cast<double>(a);
    }
    
    if (b.type()==typeid(string))
    {
        string s;
        s=boost::any_cast<string>(b);
        if (find(s.begin(),s.end(),',')!=s.end())
            for (int i=0;i<s.length();i++)
                if 
 (s[i]==',') s=s.substr(0,i)+'.'+s.substr(i+1);
        numb=atof(s.c_str());
    }
    else 
    {
        numb=boost::any_cast<double>(b);
    }
    
    if (numa>numb)
        out=numa;
    else if (numa<numb)
        out=numb;
    else
        out=numa;
    
    return out;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Return vector of all prefixes from shortest to longest of the input string
>>> all_prefixes("abc")
{"a", "ab", "abc"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using 
 namespace std;
vector<string> all_prefixes(string str){
    vector<string> out;
    string current="";
    for(int i=0;i<str.length();i++){
        if(str[i]=='\0'){
            out.push_back(current);
            current="";
        }
        else{
            current+=str[i];
        }
    }
    return out;
}
/*
Return vector of all suffixes from shortest to longest of the input string
>>> all_suffixes("abc")
{"bc", "ab", "c"}
*/
vector<string> all_suffixes(string str){
    vector<string> out;
    string current="";
    for(int i=0;i<str.length();i++){
        if(str[i]=='\0'){
            out.push_back(current);
            current="";
        }
        else{
            current+=str[i];
        }
    }
    return out;

in the vector that are odd. Ignore numbers that are negative or not integers.

double_the_difference({1, 3, 2, 0}) == 1 + 9 + 0 + 0 = 10

double_the_difference({9, -2}) == 81
double_the_difference({0}) == 0

    /* 
    Evaluates polynomial with coefficients xs at point x. return xs[0] + xs[1] * x + xs[1] * x^2 +.... xs[n] * x^n

    }
    return sum;
}

 namespace std;
float max_element(vector<float> l){

  }
 }
 return max_val;
}

}

Strange sorting, is when you start with the minimum value,
then maximum of the remaining integers, then minimum and so on.

Examples:
strange_sort_vector({1, 2, 3, 4}) == {1, 4, 2, 3}

vector<int> strange_sort_list(vector<int> lst){
    vector<int> out={};
    sort(lst.begin(),lst.end());
    int 
 l=0,r=lst.size()-1;
    while (l<r)
    {
        int mid=(r+l)/2;
        if (lst[mid]<lst[l])
        {
            out.push_back(lst[mid]);
            l=mid+1;
        }
        else if (lst[mid]>lst[r])
        {
            r=mid-1;
        }
        else
        {
            out.push_back(lst[mid]);
            l=mid+1;
            r=mid-1;
        }
    }
    return out;
}
